0.name: structural type system
0.description: major class of type system, in which type compatibility and equivalence are determined by the type's actual structure or definition, and not by other characteristics such as its name or place of declaration

2.name: dynamic typing
2.description: a style of dynamic typing in object oriented programming

3.name: nominative typing
3.description: major class of type system, in which compatibility and equivalence of data types is determined by explicit declarations and/or the name of the types

6.name: partial inference typing
6.description: a style of dynamic typing in object-oriented programming

7.name: inference typing
7.description: automatic detection of the data type of an expression in a programming language

8.name: static typing
8.description: type system paradigm where all type checking is done at compile time

10.name: duck typing
10.description: a style of dynamic typing in object oriented programming

11.name: polymorphism
11.description: in programming languages and type theory, accessing different types using a common interface

12.name: strong typing
12.description: specificity of a programming language's syntax when manipulating types of data

13.name: weak typing
13.description: the opposite of strong typing discipline
